messages.content: What is ComfyUI-SaveImageWithMetaData?
ComfyUI-SaveImageWithMetaData is a custom node for ComfyUI that adds a node to save images with metadata (PNGInfo) obtained from the input values of each node.
What are the installation steps for ComfyUI-SaveImageWithMetaData?

To install ComfyUI-SaveImageWithMetaData, navigate to the custom_nodes directory in your ComfyUI installation and run the command: git clone https://github.com/nkchocoai/ComfyUI-SaveImageWithMetaData.git
What node is added by ComfyUI-SaveImageWithMetaData?
ComfyUI-SaveImageWithMetaData adds the 'Save Image With Metadata' node, which saves the received input 'images' as images with metadata (PNGInfo).
How is metadata obtained for the 'Save Image With Metadata' node?
Metadata for the 'Save Image With Metadata' node is obtained from the inputs of the found KSampler node using 'sampler_selection_method' and previously executed node inputs.
What is the purpose of the 'filename_prefix' in the 'Save Image With Metadata' node?
The 'filename_prefix' in the 'Save Image With Metadata' node specifies a string (Key) that is replaced with the acquired information in the filename.
What methods are available for selecting the KSampler node in the 'sampler_selection_method'?
The available methods for selecting the KSampler node in the 'sampler_selection_method' are Farthest, Nearest, and By node ID.
What does the 'Create Extra MetaData' node do?
The 'Create Extra MetaData' node allows you to specify additional metadata to be added to the saved image.
What metadata is assigned to the saved images by ComfyUI-SaveImageWithMetaData?

ComfyUI-SaveImageWithMetaData assigns metadata such as Positive prompt, Negative prompt, Steps, Sampler, CFG Scale, Seed, Clip skip, Size, Model, Model hash, VAE, VAE hash, Loras, Embeddings, Batch index, Batch size, and Hashes for Model, Loras, and Embeddings, which can be used with Civitai.
Which nodes and extensions are compatible with ComfyUI-SaveImageWithMetaData?
The compatible nodes and extensions for ComfyUI-SaveImageWithMetaData can be found in the following files and directories: py/defs/captures.py, py/defs/samplers.py, and py/defs/ext/.
What is ComfyUI-SaveImageWithMetaData?
ComfyUI-SaveImageWithMetaData is a custom node for ComfyUI that allows saving images with metadata (PNGInfo) extracted from the input values of each node.
How can ComfyUI-SaveImageWithMetaData be installed?

To install ComfyUI-SaveImageWithMetaData, navigate to the ComfyUI custom_nodes directory in the command line and run the following command: git clone https://github.com/nkchocoai/ComfyUI-SaveImageWithMetaData.git
What information can be replaced in the filename_prefix when using the Save Image With Metadata node?

The filename_prefix in the Save Image With Metadata node allows replacing various information such as seed value, image width, image height, positive prompt, negative prompt, checkpoint name, and date of generation.
What are the available options for the sampler_selection_method in the Save Image With Metadata node?

The sampler_selection_method in the Save Image With Metadata node has three options: Farthest (selects the farthest KSampler node), Nearest (selects the nearest KSampler node), and By node ID (selects the KSampler node with the specified node ID).
What is the purpose of the Create Extra MetaData node?
The Create Extra MetaData node in ComfyUI-SaveImageWithMetaData allows specifying additional metadata to be added to the image being saved.
What metadata can be added to the saved image using ComfyUI-SaveImageWithMetaData?

ComfyUI-SaveImageWithMetaData can add various metadata to the saved image, including positive prompt, negative prompt, steps, sampler, CFG scale, seed, clip skip, size, model, model hash, VAE, VAE hash, Loras, embeddings, batch index, batch size, and hashes for model, Loras, and embeddings.
Where can information about supported nodes and extensions for ComfyUI-SaveImageWithMetaData be found?
Information about supported nodes and extensions for ComfyUI-SaveImageWithMetaData can be found in the following files and directories: py/defs/captures.py, py/defs/samplers.py, and py/defs/ext/.
